story:
Summary

We are Artists Inspiring Action, a collective of creative world changers, and we've partnered with Rooftop 519 and The Justice Conference to create a huge interactive art installation and mobilization project to inspire people to do justice.

Our mission is two-fold: 

First, to produce an interactive art installation at The Justice Conference in Philadelphia on Feb 22nd and 23rd. The art piece will represent eight justice themes: war, slavery, homelessness, hunger, health, sanitation, education, and family. Attendees of the conference will participate in completing the art piece by hand painting a pre-printed canvas and filling free-form areas with their own inspired contributions.

Second, to produce an accompanying book alongside the art piece that will highlight the stories of people working towards justice and practical ways for individuals to get involved in change from their home communities. 


The Organizations

We will be partnering with eight organizations which we will be highlighting in the action guide as great examples of doing justice.  


The Artists

We have two amazing lead artists that are guiding our creative work:

PopeSaintVictor is currently the Lead Creative for the non-profit Blood:Water Mission. PopeSaintVictor is a leader in photography, graphic media and vector imaging. 

Jacob Herring is a photographer, painter, and creative genius. Jacob helped lead the Artists Inspiring Action display at the 2012 Justice Conference in Portland.

Look for more info on our artists in upcoming videos and bios. 

What We Need & What You Get

A large portion of the $30,000 is for the printing of the book, created in partnership with our friends at Eye See Media (www.eyeseeonline.com). Through this book participants will have access to information, inspiring stories and organizations that are making things happen; it will give them the tools to get creative acts of justice happening in their own communities.

Your partnership also helps with art material cost, artist remuneration, dispays, rigging  transportation, housing and other overhead costs involved in making all this happen. Your support means inspiring more people to help bring justice to those in need. 
 

The Impact

Justice is about doing. This interactive exhibit will inspire attendees of the conference to get involved and be part of making justice happen. The mural will be completed over the course of the 2-day event as people use their hands, words and original art to express their desire to commit to, speak about and engage social justice. The intent is to temporarily place the final mural in Philadelphia for display after The Justice Conference, inviting even more people to get involved and work towards justice. 

Other Ways You Can Help 

  • Paint with us in Philly at the Justice Conference. 
  • Spread the word through your network. 
  • Support and partner with a financial contribution to this Indiegogo campaign. 

Together, we can see what #justicedoes

story:
UPLIFT THE GIFTS: FOOD & SHELTER FOR HOMELESS

Who is Michael Lafrance Lynch? I am an artist who believes that art represents

spiritalism that reaches the core of human beings.... also I feel that art is essential to people's lives. Recently I was selected in The Bombay Sapphire / Russell Simmons' Artisan Series Competition Search aimed at discovering TheNext Big Name in visual arts! Out of 4,500 submits, I was selected one of the twelve nation's most imaginative artist in Miami's famed Art Basel, which is the largest art exhibition in America!

In pursuing my philanthropic goals my company LAFRANCE (The Visual) ARTS main agenda is to help the homeless, each piece of artwork that is purchased, 40% of the  sell of this artwork is donated to a selected homeless shelter ( JoyJunction) and food bank (Road Runner Food Bank). I was homeless for two years , and have a deep passion for anyone in this situation. With your contribution... you DO 'uplift' the gifts... the creativity of artist (his work) and the gift of giving and helping people who are less fortunate. I need $3,500.00, 1/2 will go to the artist supplies to create artwork, the other half will be available funds to give to foodbank and homeless shelter as pre-pledges and set up the funding between my company and these entities.

The perks from your contribution would be a great  gift !!! For $25.00 a (12x18 print )/$50.00-$100.00 ( 20x30 print) of selected artworks will be sent to you for your thoughtful gift of giving!!! If my goals are'nt met .. I still can put the money raised to buy supplies to produce artwork for sell, my company is already committed to the donation of 15% to entities. When you help people to become self sustaining, their lives may start as blank canvas, but with our help we can create a masterpiece for all the world to see. FOOD & SHELTER are very important to human beings..we are all connected and have a purpose to fulfill...me being homeless, I learned not to take nothing for granted! This FEB. 26, 2013 .. I made a donation of  2 works of my art.. to THE ROAD RUNNER FOOD BANK. (fund raiser) I feel ..if YOU can make a positive effect in someone's life, YOU should act on it, instead of just talking about it ..BE ABOUT IT.. this is your chance to help people.. remember, by the grace of GOD, YOU may be HOMELESS!!! If you can't make a contribution.. tell others about this project or Indiegogo to get started on your campaign!

In closing,we are creative beings, our lives become a work of art.. and creativity is my GIFT from GOD - to the world.

story:
You can still order by emailing Info@Ricature.com and we will get back to you right away.

For those that have already ordered, please send your photo and favorite artist to: Info@Ricature.com

Thank you all for your generous support through our campaign!

jonsusan2004@comcast.com and hawkinskatirnal@yahoo.com, we are unable to email you as the email got returned undeliverable. Please email us as info@ricature.com so we can get you drawn! Thanks :)

Support an Artist, Give a Great Gift

For each drawing ordered, you are directly supporting the artists you choose. The drawing themselves make the perfect gift for friends, loved ones, pets, or for yourself!

  • Quit crowding Facebook profiles with "Happy Birthday" messages and get a friend a great digital gift for their birthday!
  • Wow the bride and groom with a set of lovely drawings.
  • Remember a loved one with an artist's touch.
  • Get a snazzy avatar for your favorite video game.
  • Show your favorite pet how much you care.
  • And more...

 

Help us Share Our Story

We believe that artists have a skill. We also believe that making a living as an artist is hard--especially in the beginning. We feel that the economics of artwork, as they are currently setup (galleries, etc.), do not encourage and support artists of all types. If we can meet our goal, we want to foster and allow artists to make a living using their skill through completing our website--while still leaving the creativity in their hands.

 

Finishing The Website

If we reach our goal, we will finish and launch the site. The idea for the website is simple:

(1) Select Your Artist - You can choose your artist by browsing their examples. Filter the artists based on a particular style or feel.

(2) Upload Your Photo - Upload a picture of yourself, your friend, a family member, or even your fish! You can upload a picture from your computer, from a web link, and from your and your friend's Google+ and Facebook albums.

(3) Socialize and Enjoy - After checkout, your artist begins drawing your picture in their unique style. Once drawn, the artist is paid for their time and talent and your drawing is available to download or placed right back into a Facebook album.

 

The Pledges

After contributing, we will contact you via email to get your photo and artist choice.

1 to 6 Faces - Pledges are straight forward: how many faces do you want drawn? Then you get to decide how and who draws those faces by selecting one or more of our artists.

If you pledge 4 faces, you can have a picture of:

  • Yourself drawn by 4 artists (1x4)
  • You and your best friend drawn by 2 artists (2x2)
  • You in one photo and three of your friends in another by 1 artist (4x1)
  • Etc.

You choose the combination!

Be the Model - Watch our video about the website. As artists join the site, they will draw from our sample photos (like the one you already see). Artists will draw the samples in order from left to right (important to know).

In the last month, we have had our sample photo drawn by about a dozen artists. The prospect of having dozens, maybe even a hundred artists drawing our photo is an exciting idea as art fans--which is why we put in this pledge. You could be drawn by the next Picasso!
 

The Artists

Interested Artists - Are you an artist interested in joining? Draw and upload our sample photo and we will post your work here. If you know of an artist, please email them our project--we would love to hear from them!

Pledgers - Our artist list is subject to change and we will be confirming each artists availability to draw at the end of our project before reaching out to you.

 

- See All Artists -

Boslass:


David Ayala:


D-Art:


Shippeetoons:


Konco:


Konco:


Draculafetus:


Hironan:


Janielescueta:



Marvelheads:


Taylor Bingham:


Tleshian:



- See All Artists -

story:
Saturday, November 8th was the Lawrenceville Artists' Studio Tour. It was a wonderful day for Radiant Hall with an estimated 500 visitors to our artist community building. Unfortunately, two studios were vandalized towards the end of the event. We need your help in covering these damages.

It is disgusting that we even have to do this, but five large artist prints were ripped and a sculpture was toppled over. We put a lot of effort into hosting this event every year and we love inviting the public into our studios to engage with them about our art practices. If everyone who visited Radiant Hall on Saturday pitched in $1, we'd have a great start towards covering the damages made by the shameful individual(s).

Radiant Hall is so lucky to have a supportive community of artists and art lovers. We thank you for coming out to the event and hope you can donate what you can. 

100% of funds raised will be given to the Artists to re-create the damaged work.

story:
Hi all, my name is Laurie Crosby of Laurie Crosby Designs.  I've lived in California my whole life, and I love it here.  I became a wheelchair user in 2000 after a car accident.  Since then I have branched out into new areas and hobbies trying to fulfill my passion to create.  My previous passion, cake decorating, has proven too strenuous (50lb bags of chocolate, anyone?), so now I find beauty in making jewelry.  I'd love to start sharing some of this beauty with the world.  Can you help me do that?

With your donations I will be able to market my work and fund further projects.  Advertising is crucial when beginning a small enterprise.  My work can be as fabulous as anything but if people can't find it, then it's wasted.

I am asking for $500 to fund online marketing and raw materials for further projects.  I have an Etsy shop with over 200 handcrafted items, but it needs traffic.  Facebook ads have been good to me, and I am looking into building my own website through a local vendor.  Your donations will help me get myself out there!  Even if I don't reach my goal, the funds will be used mostly toward marketing.

Although marketing is somewhat straightforward, Facebook ads can be confusing.  In the past few weeks I have been quickly learning tips and tricks of the trade.  Almost %30 of my eyeball traffic comes from FB ads.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't donate, please share my Etsy shop link to help increase traffic.  The web address is https://www.etsy.com/shop/LaurieCrosbyDesigns. Tweet, Like, Pin, thanks!

story:
Artists...You've finished your masterpiece,..time to prepare it for transport to your art show, to be scanned, or delivering it to your client. You have a choice of bubble wrap, shrink wrap, bed sheets, foam sheets, blankets, cardboard and plastic bags..or any combination of these.

All of these are clumsy, wasteful, time consuming, costly, dangerous to your valued originals,  and unprofessional. One question, Are you tired of looking and feeling unprofessional with this method ? I was. I checked everywhere for a solution, I asked many seasoned artists..there simply wasn't anything out there. So I decided to change that.

My name is Debra Blades,

 I am a Fine Art, Gold, Silver and Copper leaf Abstract artist from BC. Using hand made papers from around the world as well as acrylic, these metals, of gold silver or copper has a very subtle effect that is burnished with the paint, and is very reflective, especially when the lights hit them, causing them to 'glow' from within. I usually work on medium to larger canvases. This one is "HEY JUDE" my signature piece..most of my work is named after The Beatles songs..as it is their music that has most inspired me..don't worry, there is no copyright on song titles.

My problem of transporting my original canvas pieces was a nightmare to me, I knew other artists were having the same problem, that after trying endlessly to find something and couldn't, I came up with a design that solves this need.

'MASTERPIECE TO GO' adjustable, professional Art Portfolios was born ! "Grab and Go' came about because most artists would tell me.. “I am a grab and go kinda of person”..so the handles were never made as part of each bag, but as an OPTION, an adjustable, detachable handle, sold separately.


'Grab and Go' came about because most artists would tell me.. “I am a grab and go kinda of person”..so the handles were never made as part of each bag, but as an OPTION, an adjustable, detachable handle, sold separately.

First it had to have to ability to hold the various shapes of canvases, SQUARE, RECTANGLE, and OBLONG..okay..fixed that..as I have these three shapes...then also the different sizes...well because there are so many sizes..I knew it had to be adjustable, to fit an assortment of canvases....solved that problem as well with the drawstring and lock closure at the back...one size of my portfolio bags, fit a few different sizes of canvases. Load from the back.. Now it had to be cost effective, affordable... they are..as each one can hold 1-3 canvases, gallery or exhibition size because of the two inside lightly padded areas. Now, they had to be fast, and easy to use, well they are that too, because you can load and protect 1-3 canvases, even the largest sizes, in less than 3 minutes. That is huge ! I remember the last show I did, I loaded up 8 large 36" x 48" x 1.5" canvases in just 3 of my Masterpiece To Go Art Portfolios,  and was driving away in my van with them within 15 MINUTES. They were stacked easily, without fear of scratching or damaging my valued originals.  

Remember, when you handle your artwork with care,

people will believe it has value.

****************************



As artists, we have portfolios for our proofs or our prints, all of which can be replaced if damage occurs, but what if one of our originals gets a scratch or a scuff..how much time and effort is needed to repair this..it is enough to make you physically sick when you damage an original.. Another thing I like to consider is, as music is art, imagine a violinist arriving at the concert with her instrument wrapped in bubble wrap and a plastic bag. It's not ever likely to ever happen.

Masterpiece To Go Portfolios was recently used in the 2013 Calgary Floods  http://www.huffingtonpost.ca/news/calgary-flooding/  to transport a lot of very valuable art, for collectors and galleries, as one of the testimonials below describes.

**********

Masterpiece To Go Art Portfolios, is PATENT PENDING, and is available in SQUARE, RECTANGLE, AND OBLONG, and each shape is in S-M, M-L, AND L-XL.

My purpose for this campaign is to:

*Replenish my stock,

*Add a couple new sizes, 

*Add new designs I have in the making.

*Advertising and Trade show Fees.

*Administration fees.

* Rental of a storage unit.

*Extra staff.

*The floor display stands,

 (that will be professionally wrapped with all the information, instructions, and testimonials for a dramatic statement in the stores.)

************

MASTERPIECE TO GO PORTFOLIOS is a product that has all these features:

*LIGHTWEIGHT..made of Rainfly fabric, the lightest, and strongest fabric used by the most experienced of back packers.

*DURABLE...will withstand years of normal use.

*QUICK AND EASY....you can load and protect 1-3 canvases in less than 3 minutes.

*PULL AND LOCK CLOSURE...adjusts to allow your originals to be safe and secure for transport or storage.

*2 LIGHTWEIGHT INSIDE PADDED AREAS...to protect from rubs or scratches.

*WATER RESISTANT FABRIC....same as backpackers require.

*EACH WILL HOLD 1-3 CANVASES....very cost effective, and time saving.

*ADJUSTABLE TO 3 SIZES....each can gather down to a smaller size.

*SEPARATE STUFF SACK...when not in use each portfolio will fit nicely away in it’s own stuff sack the size of a ladies handbag.

*ENVIRONMENTALLY FRIENDLY....stop throwing away shrink wrap, bubble wrap and plastic bags, washing sheets.

*************

TESTIMONIALS YOU ASK ? 

Here are a few that will be on the sides of the store floor displays.


~Denise Williams:

“Any artist who has ever packed, transported or stored art knows the risks involved. I could go on for pages talking about all the things that have happened over the years, the endless hours ...of touch-ups resulting from needless accidents, but If you’re looking at this, you know.
When I first saw the Grab & Go Bags, I was astounded by the elegant design and ease of use. Now we all know an artist never packs art unless they have to, but I was so excited by these bags, that not only did I pack the right size canvases for the bag in a matter of minutes, from start to finish, but I was literally compelled to repack smaller works multiple times simply to see how well it worked. All so simple. As the experience was so delightful, I became over zealous and literally slide the bag all over the floor to see what would happen. The works stayed in place.
I became more excited and actually put them in the back of my car for a test drive. For the first time in my life while transporting art I did not have to drive like I had loose eggs in the car praying I would not have to brake fast. I found myself driving normally and then decided to take some dirt roads. Next thing, I was driving as though I was in a hurry over the rough dirt roads in Santa Fe, New Mexico.
When I got home, I went one step further and tossed the bag down in the snow. I admit, I did that. Can you imagine that? When I got inside and opened the bag, all pieces were safe and securely in place!
The following ritual of gratitude to artist Debra Blade for inventing these bags you will have to experience yourself. I cannot say enough about them. I cannot imagine the art world without the Masterpiece To Go canvas portfolio cases, aka Grab & Go bags. I believe all the great masters are tipping their hats to Debra Blades for honouring the art world in such a way. Find out yourself.
~ Denise Williams, Artist
http://fineartamerica.com/profiles/denise-williams.html

********************************

~Monika Blichar:

“Wonderful product that protects delicate pieces while presenting professionalism when delivering to clients.”

www.monikablichar.com

**************************************

~ Jeanette Jarville

“I find this canvas protector a lightweight, durable, quick and convenient way to transport artwork. It not only looks clean and professional when delivering art to a customer, it is easy to wrap and unwrap. No more taping up the paper wrapping or cloth around the work and dealing with the mess or disposal of the packing afterwards. It’s a green way to go and it’s great that one cover will work for up to 3 paintings! “
http://www.jeanettejarville.com/

**********************

~ Chris Collacott

“They are pretty awesome!”

http://www.avision.ca/

***********************************

~Paul Constable Artists In Canada

“This is a product who’s time has come”.

http://www.artistsincanada.com/

**************

Denise Rube

"Debra introduced me and demo'd Masterpiece to Go soon after she developed the product. I think it is awesome the way it can be compact or when full, very supportive of the art placed inside. I work for an art gallery and have recommended it to several of the artists we represent. I continue to share this information with my Facebook friends and wish Debra the very best - both as an artist and creator of this excellent product."

http://www.centralcity.ca/smart-frames-accents-2/

***************

~Rouge Gallery, Saskatoon

Yes I have used it for a few deliveries and felt that it worked very well for small to medium sized paintings. I would consider using the portfolios on a regular basis.
Wanda Underhill

http://www.rougegallery.ca/

*************************************************

~Shirley & Rod
Art Connection
Calgary

We have managed to use them twice so far.

Shortly after the floods we received a call from an elderly couple who have been collecting art for at least 50 years.

Most of the images were taken out of the ruined frames, water damaged, with mud etc. on them.

We were able to pick them all up, have them

sealed in plastic bags and then placed in the artwork carrying bag and then transport them to a couple of places in Calgary

for appraisal and seeing if they were able to be salvaged. They were all in one bag rather than us carrying 5 plastic sleeve bags.

Made us look very professional to have a bag big enough for all the pieces!!

On Saturday we were in Banff picking up a couple of images from an Art Gallery.

One of the pieces was framed (33" x 36")

but we were able to put it in the bag.

Much better than walking down Banff Avenue

with a picture under our arm.
http://artconnectioncalgary.com/page.php?4

************************************


~Flora Bowley –Intuitive Artist

" A wonderful addition to every artist's studio!"

http://braveintuitiveyou.com/

********************** 

 I also hand paint and hand sew canvas journals with an abstract pattern. These journals contain 140 pages of quality 70 pound paper, suitable for watercolor, ink, acrylic and charcoal. They measure 6" x 9" x 2" and each have a unique button closer and two large inside pockets. It is a DELUXE, BLACK WHITE AND SILVER JOURNAL that I am offering for one of my perks.

(Each one will be different abstract pattern.)



PERKS : With Love and Gratitude for your support, I wanted to make sure that I have a wide variety of choices for perks. I also decided to give you more value for your contribution dollar, going above and beyond in retail value. 

 

http://www.debrascollageart.com/

https://www.facebook.com/pages/Debras-Originals/171903289663646

Masterpiece To Go Art Portfolios is also available for purchase directly from my Facebook Page:

 https://www.facebook.com/MasterpieceToGo
story_txt:
Artists...You've finished your 
masterpiece,..time to prepare it for transport to your art show, to be scanned, 
or delivering it to your client. You have a choice of bubble wrap, shrink wrap, 
bed sheets, foam sheets, blankets, cardboard and plastic bags..or any 
combination of these. All of these are clumsy, wasteful, time consuming, 
costly, dangerous to your valued originals,  and unprofessional. One question, 
Are you tired of looking and feeling unprofessional with this method ? I was. I 
checked everywhere for a solution, I asked many seasoned artists..there simply 
wasn't anything out there. So I decided to change that.My name is Debra Blades, I am a Fine Art, Gold, Silver and  Copper leaf Abstract artist from BC. Using hand made papers from around the world as well as acrylic, these metals, of gold silver or copper has a very subtle effect that is burnished with the paint, and is very reflective, especially when the lights hit them, causing them to 'glow' from within. I usually work on medium to larger  canvases. This one is "HEY JUDE" my signature piece..most of my work is named after The Beatles songs..as it is their music that has most inspired me..don't worry, there is no copyright on song titles.My problem of transporting my original  canvas pieces was a nightmare to me, I knew other artists were having the same problem, that after trying endlessly to find  something and couldn't, I came up with a design that solves this need. 'MASTERPIECE TO GO' adjustable, professional Art 
Portfolios was born ! "Grab and Go' came about because most artists would tell 
me.. “I am a grab and go kinda of person”..so the handles were never made as 
part of each bag, but as an OPTION, an adjustable, detachable handle, sold 
separately.'Grab and Go' came about because most artists would tell me.. “I am a grab and 
go kinda of person”..so the handles were never made as part of each bag, but as 
an OPTION, an adjustable, detachable handle, sold separately.First it had to have to ability to hold the 
various shapes of canvases, SQUARE, RECTANGLE, and OBLONG..okay..fixed that..as 
I have these three shapes...then also the different sizes...well because there 
are so many sizes..I knew it had to be adjustable, to fit an assortment of 
canvases....solved that problem as well with the drawstring and lock closure at 
the back...one size of my portfolio bags, fit a few different sizes of canvases. 
Load from the back.. Now it had to be cost effective, affordable... they are..as 
each one can hold 1-3 canvases, gallery or exhibition size because of the two 
inside lightly padded areas. Now, they had to be fast, and easy to use, well 
they are that too, because you can load and protect 1-3 canvases, even the 
largest sizes, in less than 3 minutes. That is huge ! I remember the last show I 
did, I loaded up 8 large 36" x 48" x 1.5" canvases in just 3 of my Masterpiece To Go Art Portfolios,  and was driving 
away in my van with them within 15 MINUTES. They were stacked easily, without 
fear of scratching or damaging my valued originals.  Remember, when you handle your artwork with care, people will believe it has 
value.****************************
As artists, we have portfolios for our 
proofs or our prints, all of which can be replaced if damage 
occurs, but what if one of our originals gets a scratch or a scuff..how much

story:
Variations est un projet d'exposition vivante, à la croisée entre projection de cinéma, exposition d’art et événement direct.


Variations est née d'une envie d'explorer le rapport entre image animée et musique. Le point de départ est un dialogue entre l'album musical The lady with the Monkey de Camille Petit et le film Eleonor d'Alice Petit. Les deux oeuvres ont été crées alternativement : l'album comporte des morceaux reprenant des thèmes composés pour une première version du film. La version finale du film a ensuite été reconstruite en connexion avec un de ces morceaux. La relation musique/image est poussée au-delà du travail de composition de musique originale pour un film et au-delà du clip accompagnant un morceau. Les deux parties établissent un jeu de correspondances, plutôt qu'elles ne s'accompagnent.


Pendant six heures le vendredi  18 juillet, des artistes exploreront en direct la relation entre musique et image animée.


Nous voulons poursuivre cette expérimentation en présentant le travail d'autres jeunes artistes ayant un même commun intérêt pour la musique et l'image animée, puis en ouvrant cette exploration à l'expérience du direct avec des dessins et des montages vidéos réalisés pendant des performances musicales. Nous invitons  des réalisateurs à diffuser leurs court-métrages choisis pour leur force visuelle évocatrice et nous offrirons au spectateur une expérience en direct des rencontres hasardeuses entre musique et films


De par sa nature événementielle, ce projet propose de donner accès à des objets filmiques hors de l'immersion passive de la salle obscure mais également d'inscrire la pratique plastique dans le temps et le direct. De nombreuses oeuvres présentées seront fixées, la plupart subiront une transformation en direct, seront interprétées en direct ou seront simplement créées en direct.

Teaser de l'album The Lady with the monkey video par Guillaume Aventurin



LE 18 JUILLET DE 17h à 23h, AUX FRIGOS, PARIS 13e


Produite par l'association NEMNI, notre exposition prend de l'ampleur et nous avons besoin de votre aide pour achever sa création.

En trois semaines seulement, nous avons rallié plus de vingt jeunes artistes plastiques, cinéastes et musiciens. Ainsi que :

* 100m2 d’espace d’exposition

* 3 heures de vidéos et de films

* 2 heures de musique live

* 2 heures de performances visuelles

* 6 heures d'installations électro-acoustiques

Et puisque nous aimons les risques et les innovations, ‘Variations’ inaugurera le ‘piano vidéaste’. Travaillant autour du logiciel  MAX, cette installation ‘vidéo-acoustique' donne au public un accès ludique  à la création artistique…


Tout ce qui nous manque maintenant, c’est une aide financière. La date du 18 juillet approche et c’est vers vous que nous nous tournons !

Il nous faut 1500€ au minimum pour que le projet voie le jour.

Bien sûr, afin qu'il se fasse dans les meilleures conditions, artistiques, techniques et de confort pour les artistes, plus serait le bienvenu :-) !

Les fonds serviront  :

* A la location du matériel audiovisuel, la fabrication et l'installation des oeuvres (vidéo-projecteur, écrans, installations techniques, matériel informatique, matériel électro-acoustique, éclairage et sonorisation)

* Au défraiement total et au confort des artistes et des techniciens qui travaillent sur le projet


En plus de son aspect créatif, Variations soutient la jeune création :


Offrir une plate-forme pour exposer des projets expérimentaux qui ne sont pas toujours représentés dans les circuits traditionnels est une priorité pour notre association d’artistes NEMNI !

L'exposition permettra de présenter les travaux de jeunes artistes talentueux, en phase de reconnaissance.


MERCI A TOUS pour votre aide.

Collaborez et faites circuler!!!!

Mais le plus important : VENEZ voir le travail des artistes ce 18 juillet aux FRIGOS à PARIS entre 17h00 et 23h00!

Artistes participants : Shola Amoo, Guillaume Aventurin, Nadège Billery, Julien Blanchard, Manuel Bolanos, Sonia Bricout, Lena Brisson, Emilie Essel,  Xavier Gélard, Ola Jankowska, Morgan Lowenstein, Jenny Lu, Jonathan Martin, Camille Petit, Alice Petit, Ariel Pintor, David Rousselet, Hong Jimmy Seng, Vladilen Vierny, Antoine Villedieu, Joe Watson, Patrick Zoroddu

NEMNI

L’association NEMNI est une toute jeune association travaillant à la production, la diffusion et l’exposition d’oeuvres multimédias et de spectacles vivant.

teaser de l'album The Lady with the monkey

story:
En cette période difficile, plusieurs artistes de nos communautés ne peuvent exercer leur métier.

Nous comprenons et respectons cette nécessité imposée par notre gouvernement et sommes de tout coeur avec les victimes et l'entourage des personnes touchées directement par le COVID19.

Cette collecte de fonds a pour but de soutenir les artistes drags de Québec qui doivent faire face a la fermeture de leurs lieux de travail. 

Une partie importante de la communauté drag n'a pas d'emploi de jour et est confrontée de façon soudaine a cette réalité.

Suite au succès de la dernière édition nous vous proposons donc un deuxième spectacle virtuel ce mardi, 14 avril, 2020  20H sur Youtube et possiblement, d'autres événements.  Nous ne manquons pas d'imagination!

Les artistes se sépareront les recettes de cette collecte de fonds. 

L'animation et la technique se feront de manière bénévole.

Merci de votre support! C'est grandement apprécié.
story_txt: En cette période difficile, plusieurs artistes de nos communautés ne peuvent exercer leur métier.Nous comprenons et respectons cette nécessité imposée par notre gouvernement et sommes de tout coeur avec les victimes et l'entourage des personnes touchées directement par le COVID19.Cette collecte de fonds a pour but de soutenir les artistes drags de Québec qui doivent faire face a la fermeture de leurs lieux de travail. Une partie importante de la communauté drag n'a pas d'emploi de jour et est confrontée de façon soudaine a cette réalité.Suite au succès de la dernière édition nous vous proposons donc un deuxième spectacle virtuel ce mardi, 14 avril, 2020  20H sur Youtube et possiblement, d'autres événements.  Nous ne manquons pas d'imagination!Les artistes se sépareront les recettes de cette collecte de fonds. L'animation et la technique se feront de manière bénévole.Merci de votre support! C'est grandement apprécié.

story:
YOUR 'GLOBAL ArtXchanges' care instantly helps! 

Our Mission is sending New 'Art Supplies' to Needy Youth, Worldwide. WE NEED YOUR HELP with any Contribution. [We also work on grants and sponsors]. ~We've been very successful. *We need to create a documentary soon to promote more.

Note: $75.00 donation or more will have your name as a credit in the documentary film, as associate sponsors.

OUR STORY: We desire to RE-DIRECT youth energy to the Arts; not negative influences as gangs, involved with drugs and guns. It's all meaningful!

This campaign is about caring with compassion.

  • 'GLOBAL ArtXchanges' was formed officially 7 years ago here in Canada. After a year of research we felt there was a big gap in only sending proper Arts Supplies (not money) to get to needy youth into arts. We have already been into 3 continents. SUPPLIES GET THERE!

Now we have more contacts Worldwide & have sent basic art materials [not money]to many impoverished to poverty stricken places in 3 continents. 

  • It is much about caring, compassion & determination. 'GLOBAL ArtXchanges; is meant to 'enrich the lives' of the youth world-wide, who do not have the resources to have proper art supplies. We only send good basic art materials only to the contact person, who made the request.
  • Once all is a GO, we make sure they receive it. They only then need to report back to us. MANY SMILES :)))) is the biggest REWARD. We've sent materials to needy places as Nepal, Ghana and soon Haiti. We help N.W.Ontario Native youth. We have grown with over 12 world contacts, along with volunteers that are a great vital asset.

Note: VISIT the 'GALLERY' above the image and see the many neat images.

PROCESS:

The Funds go to our 3 main areas instantly:

(1)Buying and Sending Art Supplies to Needy Youth Art Groups World-wide is ongoing, so make any contribution. you like. Any amount welcome of course.

(2)We are doing a short film documentary, for wider promotion, (to be sent later to Film Festivals).

(3)To create a 'World Youth Art Peace' Exhibition, from the art given by the youth we have helped. We have already received some GREAT artworks.

We hope you'll work together with us and donate any amount. Even $5. That goes a long way for supplies we buy at extremely good low prices.

Response feedback: 'Lila'~Kathmandu, Nepal orphanage/school director: "Thank you Vesa very much for art pencils,paints and papers and more, that our kids have now which has made them so happy making nice art. We want to send you some pictures later. Much love. - Namaste, Lila.

THE IMPACT

The impact is that young artists benefit, enlivening also their family, friends and neighbourhood. The community shares in the responsibility to sustain this effort. Since the young artists have proper art supplies to work with, it enriches the spirit there, involving many in this focus of the future of their children's education. "No one can take a person’s imagination away."

http://www.vpeltonen.com/artworks/global-artxchanges-progress-album/

The e-mail is: vesa_peltonen@hotmail.com

To send your e-mail, in order to get your incentive; add your address also. Note: You can remain anonymous.

World-wide recognized logo shows we care about our earth and our youth. We need to make art as an integral part of comunity! Youth are enlivened, given more self esteem, a feeling of FREE expression in their art creating. It affects family to all communities, small to large. HELP US SPREAD IT FURTHER, TO MAKE IT HAPPEN! 

Thank you kindly, :)

Vesa Peltonen - B.F.A. B. Ed.  founder/director - Thunder Bay & Toronto, CAN.

Brad Wilson -film-maker/artist

Jo Hannah - World contacts advisor

story:
Please check the Gallery for more pictures!  I will also be posting updates of my progress and as a way to thank everyone who is helping out with labor/in-kind contributions.

Detailed Description

Once inside the grounds of the Castle of Mischief, you might notice a strange 8' square box. Perhaps it is some kind of abandoned cargo? as you approach, you notice a small door, which you duck through.
Once you enter "Tripping Through the Looking Glass", you dive inside an op-art painting surrounded by bright colors and interlocking geometric patterns. The ceiling has shapes cut out to let the glimmering silver reflections from the Castle and sunlight pour in. The silver shimmer will be incorporated into the walls of the structure giving it a sense of movement as your eyes traverse the shifting patterns inside and flowing into the surrounding area; a fully immersive experience.
At night, the brightly-colored, interior lights will illuminate the space and the light will pour out of the top of the structure. This glow will paint the castle walls and floating dust around the work drawing participants to step inside.


The photographs that you can see are examples of what will cover the entirety of the interior of the room.  The panels from which the room will be constructed have already been made.  Each panel is 4' by 8' and all of them will be stored and transported flat and then assembled on-site.

About the Artist

This is my first large-scale art project, but I have been very active in the DC/Baltimore burner community for about a year and a half.  I run a Baltimore specific-burner list, organize a monthly baltimore burner happy hour and a monthly dinner which rotates througout the DC/Baltimore/northern Virginia area.  I am also involved with Mischief DC, specifically assisting with budgeting and logistics for some of the regional burns we have attended and running a craft table. 

Project Budget

  • actual cost: $154.33 at home depot for the structure itself, including wood, screws, nails, and plastic sheeing.
  • about $111 so far at Michaels for cardstock paper, spray adhesive, and clear varnish
  • estimated transport costs:
    • $746 to transport from DC to Burning Man (based on $7 per square foot cost on DC container)
    • $518 to rent a truck to go from Baltimore, MD to Asheville NC for Transformus (based on 10' truck from Budget, returning in Asheville)

As you can see, transportation is the most expensive part of this endeavor.  I will continue to research transportation options. At the final burn of the season, the wood will be removed and burned, and the plastic sheets can hopefully be transported home relatively easily.

Why I Need Funding

I have been dreaming about making this project a reality for some time.   But, because I'm also taking a sabbatical from work this year, I need some financial help to make this dream a reality!

Want to Be More Involved?

I am also applying for art grants at some of our regional burn events to try and cover transport costs so that the piece can be seen in multiple places. I will need a team of people who can help transport and set up the piece.  Let me know if you are interested in getting more involved!

story:
Invisible Children is both an organization and a movement, seeking to create global awareness of the longstanding conflicts in Africa and bring children soldiers home. 

Temple University's Invisible Children chapter is excited to bring attention to our cause by hosting an exhibition showcasing the art of students that share our values of humanitarianism, activism and a passionate dedication to correcting social injustice in any way, shape or form. 

Arts Meets Activism will take place  October 5-13th at The Arts Garage in Philadelphia.

Our 9-day exhibition will not only include art work, but also live performances and themed events hosted by various organizations who believe in community involvement as a means of correcting social injustice. This event will be a revolutionary mix of people from across our diverse city, who have their own interpretation of what it means to be an activist. It will serve as an art gallery and place for live entertainment, as well as a place for the exchange of ideas and the beginning of ground-breaking collaboration.

Invisible Children's goal is to maintain their character as motivated misfits and masses redefining what it means to be an activist. For more information on the national organization please visit: www.invisiblechildren.com


The Impact:

Let's face it - fundraising and nonprofit work can seem very sanctimonious to some. But we are a small group of students who believe that direct community collaboration can make a HUGE impact on our lives and our world. 

We know this event will open new doors for everyone involved. Whether it be a priceless professional contact made or that perfect piece of artwork added to your almost-complete collection, no one will walk away from this event unchanged. There are so many elements to this event that we cannot possibly explore them all here in mere words. It is something you need to experience first-hand and we are providing you that rare opportunity. 


What We Need & What You Get:

Putting together an art gallery is a lot of work and costs a lot of money. What we are asking from you is to contribute to our operating budget. We need to pay for the 9-day gallery space--that is our biggest expense. But beyond that we need money for all of the other exciting things that will be going on during our exhibition. Trust us, this is going to be the most interactive art exhibition you have ever been to! We will need money for the supplies that goes into mounting and displaying art work as well as for any materials we will need for the different activities happening each night. 

We will be doing as much fundraising as possible in a bunch of different ways, but for those of you who don't know who we are, who are not living in Philadelphia or even in this country, this is how you get to know about us. Every dollar helps! 

We are a completely student-run organization. That means each member of our small but incredibly dedicated team is working their butts off in the classroom, at part time jobs and internships all while devoting amazing amounts of precious free time to this cause that we wholeheartedly believe in. 

Every person who makes a contribution will get a personal thank-you and invitation to collaborate with us on this event. 


Other Ways You Can Help

There are two incredibly helpful things you can do for us: 

1. TELL PEOPLE ABOUT IT! We need artists to submit their artwork and we need people to come look at it! We are working on creative ways to get all different kinds of people out to look at what we've put together, but there is always a group that gets left out. With your help, that won't happen - so please spread the word however you can! Tell your mom, your dad, your dog, your teacher, your barista, your hairdresser, your accountant, your plumber, your personal shopper, your personal shopper's mother-in-law, EVERYONE YOU KNOW. We honestly believe all people will benefit from the message we are trying to spread and we know the more people that know about it, the better. 

2. WORK WITH US! We are looking for anyone with any kind of message that revolves around social responsibility, activism, community involvement and development to come and share what they are doing! We want to have as many people involved as possible and it doesn't matter how - if you have an idea, tell us about it! Contact: TUICart@gmail.com

story:
Hello everyone!

First off, thank you for even making it to this page and showing support for my journey with dance and the world! I truly believe that dance has allowed me the power to travel through this world to learn and mold what I think myself and all environments can become. So I need your help! Because what I have here is the opportunity to attend the final six-day audition process at the P.A.R.T.S. (Performing Arts Research and Training Studios) Training Program in Brussels, Belgium, which only happens every three years for dancers under the age of 23. By helping me make it to this, you will place my entire self in an environment I have been dreaming about for a very long time. A place where anything is possible for my art, and the art I make with others.

WHAT I NEED FROM YOU!

My goal is to raise around $1200-$1300 for travel arrangements and food! I need any support I can get in making my way to Brussels next month. The flights are nearly $800-$900 and then I will need money for food to be able to keep my body at its best capabilities for this audition. Anything helps, from a nickel to ten dollars, I appreciate everything and anything! You can see on the side what you can receive from me as a massive thank you!

What this means for both of us

By you helping me achieve my goal, you will be supporting someone who really believes in the honesty of dance and what it can do for the world at large. I have been working incredibly hard these past couple of years to find ways of truth through dance and composition and I think I need more time developing that in a saturated yet varied environment such as P.A.R.T.S.

I auditioned at the pre-selection in New York City and was one of four Americans selected to advance to the final selection. P.A.R.T.S, under the direction of Anne Teresa de Keersmaeker, is a superior school for contemporary dance, designed to train both dancers and choreographers, while also focusing on other performing arts and theoretical training. It is a three year program that trains everyday from Monday to Friday with a vast amount of teachers and choreographers from all over the world.

There will be 190 final applicants out of nearly 1,600 initial applicants at this final selection and 50 will be chosen, all coming from different parts of the world, from Latvia to Spain. To be among those 190 dancers will not only be incredibly humbling but also a true blessing. Attending the audition itself will be a huge success on its own, and the possibility of making it even further would extend my artistry and career in ways that you or I cannot imagine. The talent that comes out of this school is empowering to just hear. Choreographers and dancers that I truly look up to and admire have gone through this program, teach there, and work with the school as guests. To be part of a world that I have only heard about and can actually physicalize would benefit my entire process as a dancer.

Other ways you can help besides the dinero!

I understand that we are all facing hard times and some people can't donate, BUT if you know anyone that can, please share this with them! And also to familiarize people with my work send them to www.marccrousillat.com. I really do think I have something to offer to this world through dance as my medium and attending this audition and possibly being part of the program will prove to be an incredible amount of experience for me to hone and expand my artistic capabilities.

All my best,
Marc Crousillat

story:
Hello my name is Arthur Pennock and I'm a full time senior at Cornish College of Art graduating with honors in May. I’m a digital painter working in illustrator and Photoshop painting drawings based of photos relating to pop culture and celebrity. This campaign is designed to help me raise the funds to print my works and maybe more for my upcoming BFA show in May and secondly to support the costs of the display of the prints during the show and after. I currently work 2 jobs with school full time so this campaign would help ease the stress of making all my ends meet for school while letting me focus and not be so bogged down at work outside of my academic responsibilities.

Where the money is going:

The money will be split about 80/20.

  • 80% Printing 20% display.

I do all my printing at my school because it’s the best deal in the city for us its $12 a liner foot and my pieces range anywhere from 6in sq at the smallest and 3ftx5ft at the largest. Ill is “smart printing” tiling the works all together and cutting them apart to use the most of my paper as possible.

The first priority is printing the material and the display will be figured out at the end if I don’t come up with full funds.

Perks include original numbered prints for contributors or commissioned works if that sounds better for you also immense amount of gratitude and appreciation for your support and belief!

Impact:

The help I get from you all will help me be seen; this fundraiser will give me the opportunity to open doors and meet people I otherwise might not be able to. If I get enough funding it will make it possible to have other shows in the future, build inventory, advertisements and allow me to brand myself. It would be like a jumpstart to a career in this field that I love and am passionate about.

Other ways you can help:

My work is born out of my connections with others so hey if you can’t donate some cash, no problem lets still hang out. If you like my work let’s get together and have a drink and have some fun. My work is all about having a good laugh and a goodnight out. I love meeting new people so let’s see what happens. I believe that everyone can benefit someone else in some way and sometimes connection is more beneficial to me then the dollars.

commissioned works if that sounds better for you also immense amount of gratitude
and appreciation for your support and belief! 
Impact:
The help I get from you all will help me be seen; this
fundraiser will give me the opportunity to open doors and meet people I otherwise
might not be able to. If I get enough funding it will make it possible to have
other shows in the future, build inventory, advertisements and allow me to
brand myself. It would be like a jumpstart to a career in this field that I love
and am passionate about. 
Other ways you can help:
My work is born out of my connections with others so hey if
you can’t donate some cash, no problem lets still hang out. If you like my work
let’s get together and have a drink and have some fun. My work is all about
having a good laugh and a goodnight out. I love meeting new people so let’s see
what happens. I believe that everyone can benefit someone else in some way and
sometimes connection is more beneficial to me then the dollars.

story:
Community in Unexpected Places

Greetings from Las Vegas is a free, all ages community event that will take place on Thursday, December 5th at the historic Gateway Motel, one of the oldest motels still in operation on the Las Vegas Strip. 

For one night, we are transforming the historic Gateway Motel into a public gallery, showcasing works and installations by local model citizens in 20 rooms that will spark discussions about sustainability in Las Vegas. 

If that wasn't enough, we will also have free local beer provided by Tenaya Creek Brewery, free food from Dona Maria Tamales, burlesque performances by Penni Piper, and local bands, the Swamp Gospel, the All-Togethers, and Ditch Diggers.

Help us put on an awesome. local Las Vegas experience for the community. Please be part of this project by donating your money, time, and ideas!

How You Can Help

After getting everything we could donated or reduced as much as possible, the entire cost of our event is $4,000. First and foremost, your contributions go toward room rentals at the Gateway Motel, an independently operated business. We are renting 20 rooms for two days, one day for set-up and the second day for the actual event. 

Next, your contributions will pay for required permits and security costs. Then your contributions will help pay for green printing materials and eco-friendly food supplies. 

For helping us put on this awesome event, we are excited to offer you unique perks - everything from vintage & commemorative matchbooks, retro motel key chains, Polaroids, limited edition prints, and guided walking tours. All items besides the vintage matchbooks are made in limited runs!

Who Are We?

Greetings from Las Vegas is being organized by Green Jelly and ILoveMikeLitt and also involves many fantastic people representing the community as a whole. You can meet some of those people in our campaign video. Americans for the Arts Action Fund is also a partnering group for the event.

Participating artists include Alicia Bridgewater, Andreana Donahue, Brian Henry, Cristina Paulos, David Sanchez Burr, Yasmina Chavez, Javier Sanchez, Diane Bush, Hannah Stills, Ginger Bruner, Kathleen Nathan, Clint Jenkins, Jennifer Kleven, Justin Favela, Krystal Ramirez, Mikayla Whitmore, Jennifer Henry, Jevijoe Vitug, Allison Streater, Joel Spencer, and Sierra Slentz. Designers and architects are represented by the UNLV Downtown Design Center, Green Chips, and Dan Laster. Participating community groups include Great Basin Permaculture, The Huntridge Foundation, Push Forward, Take Back the Tap, Ward 5 Chamber and the Harrison House, and Vegas Roots.

Special thank you to V3 Arts for their awesome video production & consultation!

This event was inspired by pop-up motel art shows like NadaDada (Reno); One Night Stand (Las Vegas); and Motel Art Show (Oxford, Mississippi).

Other Ways You Can Help

We want people involved in any way they can. 

  • Share this campaign & invite your friends to attend!
  • Do you know of community meetings or events where we can invite people to attend this event?
  • Volunteer at the event!
  • Please e-mail mikelitt@gmail.com to volunteer, share ideas, or ask questions.

Thank you!!!

story:
Box 13 Artspace, the Houston artist-run nonprofit, needs your help.  We have been a premier stop for artists and art lovers for over five years.  We love our building on Houston’s East Side, which hosts up to twenty artists and show-cases dozens of alternative art shows every year, but it needs a lot of love!  Can you help us renovate the Box to make it a better place to work and show contemporary art?

What is Box 13?

BOX13 is an artist run nonprofit innovative environment for the creation and advancement of experimental contemporary art in Houston. BOX 13 resident artists create this environment by offering affordable workspaces for emerging and established artists, while dedicating substantial gallery space in our building for the exhibition of artistic explorations by other artists throughout the year.

 

What do we want? 

We need to make Box 13 a more functional and flexible space to create art and to enjoy and contemplate art.  Our building is a former sewing machine factory repurposed into studio and exhibit space.  We need $25,000 to improve the space. Most walls in the building are masonry which makes installation very difficult and we would love to have sheetrock instead.  Our AC can’t stand up to Houston weather and our windows are not insulated so our temperature AND our energy bills are both high.  Our mop sink is permanently clogged with plaster from an exhibition cleanup gone awry.  We’d also like to get a neon sign up help increase our visibility from the street.  We have virtually no signage, which makes it very hard for guests to find us when we are showing amazing work from some of the best artists in Houston and throughout the United States.  We’d like to tackle these and other critical renovations to make Box 13 look and feel better for our artists and our guests. 

·      Sheetrock the walls

·      Install track lighting

·      AC and heating maintence and repairs

·      Insulating our windows

·      Fix the mop sink

·      Neon sign to increase visability

For this, we need money and that’s where you come in!

Box 13 wants your help!

Each of the projects we want to undertake to fix the Box takes more money than we have.  We have obtained reasonable estimates for repairs and improvements for each project, but we can’t do it alone.  Box 13 is a registered nonprofit corporation and has no permanent staff.  We rely on resident artists to do everything from curating art, making art, installing art, cleaning toilets, sweeping the galleries, maintaining the website, raising funds and taking out the trash.   In order to keep our membership fees reasonable for artists, we have made due, but the Box is overdue for a make-over. 

How you can help?

The building improvements are expensive but a donation in any amount will help.  100% of money raised through this campaign will be dedicated to increasing the functionality of Box 13’s home and enhancing the gallery and studio experience for artists and patrons alike.

What's in it for you?

Knowing that you are contributing to Houston’s dynamic art scene may be enough for you.  Others may appreciate the awesome Box 13 Artspace swag, like stickers or shirts.  Some of you pay prefer owning art made by some of Houston’s most creative artists.  Pick your contribution level, and we will make sure you know we appreciate you!


Poster:


T shirt:


Sticker:



UPDATE: Now receive a free plastic Box 13 stein with each donation over $25!

story:
There's got to be a better way! 

That's what I thought when I was scrapbooking and stamping text with 26 individual stamps laying all over the table.  I decided to design and develop a new gadget that connects all the rubber stamps together on a belt, so they're always organized.  It's been a long journey of ups and downs over the last 5 years, but I'm finally ready to make my first production run.  I've got the molds built in China, and the factory is ready to roll just as soon as I get the funds raised.  I went to China last month to visit the factory and make sure we're all geared up to go.  So exciting!  It's almost like watching a child being born. Actually, watching a child being born is way more cool, but you get the idea.  This project has been incubating for a long time and it's ready to make it's presence known to the world.                                       Is that a newborn cry I hear?

A little bit about me.

  • I'm a mom of 8 (eight) kids and love every minute of my job as a homemaker.  Well, almost every minute :)  My kids range in age from 1-16 about every two years.  They have been involved in this invention process for the last 5 years, and have been my biggest supporters.  They're planning a trip to Disneyland someday when the project brings money in, instead of taking money out.  You know kids, they get their hopes up about things that are important to them, but my dreams are a little different.  When I was 13 I went to Haiti with my Grandfather and worked in a childrens hospital in Port-au-Prince.  I decided I would be a nurse and spend my life there.  I did become a nurse, but after getting married, my husband decided he didn't want to spend his life overseas, so I'm here in the USA, wishing I could help my friends in Haiti someway.  This project is a direct result of my brainstorming ways to create an income so I can impact the Haitian community where my Grandpa's mission is located, even though I can't be there in person.  Later next month, my husband and I are taking our 6 oldest children to Haiti so they can see what I've been working for all these years.  My first invention was the Craft-n-Doodle.  It's a more complicated set of tools and has taken even longer to develop.  My journey actually started 9 years ago.  You can read my story and see that project at www.craft-n-doodle.com   If I can get the money raised to make the first production run of Alphabuddys, I'll be able to generate enough from the sale of those units to run the next batch. Then we'll be up and running!  I've got alot of other inventions in the works, and I hope that the little bit I can do, will make a big difference in the lives of the people in Haiti.  I have learned so much from them about the value of relationships over material posessions. 
  • Your contribution to this project will not only help to get this handy gadget in the hands of people who enjoy crafting, but you'll be making a much bigger impact in the lives of many people in Haiti.

What We Need & What You Get

  • Because I'm making the Alphabuddy in China, and it's a custom tool that they have to set up just for me, they require a minimum order of 10,000 units.  I also have to pay for freight to get them shipped here, so that all adds up to a grand total of $39,000.00.  I'm on my knees praying for a miracle that we can get this all raised in only 45 days.
  • The cool thing is that you can be the first in the world to ever own one of these handy gadgets.  If that doesn't give you bragging rights, I don't know what will. 
  • I'm also including some rewards that involve our trip to Haiti.  I'm a professional photographer, so I'll be doing some journalistic photography while I'm in Haiti and designing a collection to send to supporters.  If you're interested in seing the faces of those lives that will be changed by your contribution, that reward is for you.
  • If I don't reach my entire goal, I'll have to go to a local investor and give away part of my company.  I hope I don't have to do that, but I'll do what it takes to keep this moving forward.

The Impact YOU will make;

This is a chance for you to get involved in something much bigger than just a handy stamping tool.  My Grandfather's mission, "Water For Life" (www.wflhaiti.com) has been drilling water wells in Haiti for over 25 years.  This year they are moving to a new community that is incredibly poverty stricken.  They walk miles to get water, and the health of the people there is adversely affected because the water they drink is from a river where animals bathe and women do laundry.  I want to help supply this community with clean water that can come from the water wells that the crew will dig as soon as the funds are available.  Tears come to my eyes just thinking about the look on those people's face when they see clean water pouring out of the pipe for the first time after a new well is drilled.  I've been there, I've seen it.  It's amazing.  (Talk about a celebration!) It's something I want to be a part of again, and again.  Providing one water well impacts a whole community for many, many years.

If you can't help with the project, or simple don't want a stamper that can make really cool letters and doodles, could you please tell someone else you know who might want one?  I'm going to be in Haiti for 10 days of this campaign, so I need all the help I can get to pass the word along when I'm out of the range of technology.  No facebook in the boonies unfortunately. 

Thanks so much for considering this project and reading this far. I appreciate any help I can get.  From the bottom of my heart-I thank you.

Blessings to you and yours.

story: Hello, my name is Lamar Sharpe. I'm a spoken word artist/slam poet located in the Greensboro, NC area, and currently a member of the Piedmont Slam Poetry Slam Team based in Winston-Salem, NC and the captain for North Carolina A&T's CUPSI collegiate poetry slam team. I am currently raising funds to attend the National Poetry Slam 2013, which is hosted by Poetry Slam, Inc. Throughout the year, I've been practicing and training to better myself not only as a poet, but as a writer in general. Through this, it has also allowed me to grow as a person, and as my poetry grows, I grow. My experience last year at the National Poetry Slam 2012 located in Charlotte, NC allowed me to take a new step as a writer. It opened avenues never seen, and has advanced my career as a poet to an all new high. Since then, I've had opportunities to perform in Greensboro, Durham, Raleigh, Charlotte, Salisbury, and Chapel Hill in various open mics, poetry slams, and several features within the city. This year's competition is located in Boston, MA, and I will be volunteering at the event. This will allow me to take a step further in not only poetry, but also opening networking opportunities for the CUPSI team at A&T. I'm hoping to continue learning from poets nationwide about the creative art of performance poetry, competitive poetry, and the written art as a whole. I'm working hard to reach my goal through working, but I will need a little support. My goal is to reach between $600-$1000 by Sunday, August 11, 2013 to help with travel, lodging, dining, and transportation. All funds donated will immediately head to one of these four spots. If there are any questions, feel free to ask via email at SubKonscyous@gmail.com or LESharpe4@gmail.com. Also, feel free to connect with me on facebook at www.facebook.com/SubKonscyous. For more information on Poetry Slam, Inc. (PSI) and the National Poetry Slam (NPS), go to www.poetryslam.com. Finally, for more information for the Collegiate Union Poetry Slam Invitational (CUPSI), go to www.acui.org/poetryslam. Thanks for all of your support.

story:
About me

Greetings! Recently I moved to Los Angels and I have been exploring the art scene here. I have been painting and drawing ever since I held a pencil at the age of 5 and continued sporadically until I grew into adulthood. When I was 16, I obtained 1st class distinction in the state level board examination for art.

Over the years, I discovered my own uniqueness, style and approach, and worked on my refinement in that.

I draw inspiration not just from the visual reality around, but also the recollections of different experiences, travels, stories I heard, people, books those I read, movies I had watched. Different subjects inspire me and so are different media. I had worked on pencil, charcoal, oil pastels, soft and hard pastels, gauche and watercolors apart from my love for acrylics.

This campaign

I am looking for a solo-show in Los Angeles, and I am talking to different galleries and the amount of space they can give me. I need to go with a bear minimum of 10 paintings of size 24"x48". And 10 more smaller ones to come up with different configurations with the layout available in gallery.

The entire affair may cost me more than I imagined. I want to mitigate the expenses with the funds I raise here.

Your contributions really help me to work quickly towards my works, finish more in number and submit to a gallery.
 
 
                                                   One of my award winning piece.

How your contributions help meWhat I Need

  • Canvas and Paints:$1400
  • Rental of Space:    Variable cost
  • Set-up of Space:   $200 
  • Publicity:              $150 (Brochures and PR)
  • Transport:            $400 Delivery between studio and gallery
  • Opening day:        $100
  • Miscellaneous:      $200

    TOTAL                 $2450

These are average estimates. So I would like to ask until $1900, and the difference expenses, I would like to take care. If I end up getting more than $1900, it is a good thing.

                                                    I love paining. It costs too.

Let's talk rewards!

This is for a quick look. For each reward, your names also gets listed
and remembered for ever.

$5:
Limited edition Art-Postcard signed.

 

$10:

 Two different limited edition Art-Postcards. Signed.

 

$25:

 A Limited edition 16 x 30 cm Poster + Postcard. Signed.
With different art.

 

$50:

 A Set.

Two different limited edition 16 x 30 Posters. Signed
One Postcard with different art. Signed.
Catalog of my works mailed to you

 

$100:

Original piece!

You will get an art sketch on canvas, sized 12 x 22 cm
One limited edition Postcard. Tell others you own such!
Your name is embellished

$200:

 Original piece, bigger!

You will get an art sketch on canvas, sized 18 x 30 cm
One limited edition Postcard. Tell others you own such!
Your name is embellished

 

$450:

Personal painting! and Original!

An original painting 28 x 60 cm of your liking.
Plus more.
Your piece will be valued millions some day. Who knows!

$900:

Personal painting! and Original!

An original painting 28 x 60 cm of your liking.
Plus more.
Your piece will be valued millions some day. Who knows!

Pre work paintings / sketches

 



Funding mode

There are flexible and fixed campaigns on this site. I preferred flexible mode because, people can pay from both Paypal and credit cards. Though fixed mode campaign is the best option, failing to raise the last few $$ can also hold my efforts for a gallery entry. 

However the flexible mode also comes with its own risks. The case when I don't get sufficiently funded. I discuss it below.


What if I don't get totally funded

It is ideal for me to get totally funded. I have carefully designed this campaign so that every one who makes a pledge gets a reward. Unlike manufacturing related projects, each reward here can be given discreetly, even if I don't get full funds.

Rewards between $100 to $900 can be easily managed by me, because it is unique art work I do. Between $5 and $50, there should be sufficient number of pledgers, so that high quality replication work can be done.

Even if I get very few pledges for cards and posters, I can manage the delta expenses with the money I may get from original art rewards. Though it is counter productive to me, but I can handle it.

Even if I get only $5, I will put my best efforts to reward them with what I mentioned.

What if I exceed my funding goal

In some cases, overfunding can sound like a challenge because, the number of delivery commitments also increases. But for me, it will add fuel to aspire more. Even if I get, large pledges on $450, $900, or more, I will dedicate time for each commitment. But getting 100s of pledges in this category is least likely.

All said, I will naturally aspire for exceeding my funding goal. The next time when I want buy canvas, paints, brushes, or that good easel to ease my work, I will not have to calculate the number of breakfasts and lunches.

The Impact

My work has been appreciated by people, art collectors and well known artists. A very senior artist from Italy, Dario Campanile, who has met Salvador Dali in real, has appreciated my work for depth, composition and color sense. Though it was a verbal exchange in a gallery, it meant a lot to me.

My technique is very unique. I feel, the colors, the composition, the shapes and the overall picture have emotions of their own. The process of painting is an endless struggle of me to express that emotional value through different elements.

My art philosophy is based on TRUTH & BEAUTY. That beauty need not necessarily misrepresent truth for the sake of embellishment. And anything truth has an inherent beauty element in it. I need some philosophy students to argue :-)

This style and philosophy has a potential to become a matter of evolution in art. I am only in the journey and making inner findings. But I want to make big impact out of it too.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please spread the word, share this campaign with friends. Any funding will give me momentum.
story_txt:
About me
Greetings! Recently I moved to Los Angels and I have been exploring the art scene here. I have been painting and drawing ever since I held a pencil at the age of 5 and continued sporadically until I grew into adulthood. When I was 16, I obtained 1st class distinction in the state level board examination for art.
Over the years, I discovered my own uniqueness, style and approach, and worked on my refinement in that.
I draw inspiration not just from the visual reality around, but also the recollections of different experiences, travels, stories I heard, people, books those I read, movies I had watched. Different subjects inspire me and so are different media. I had worked on pencil, charcoal, oil pastels, soft and hard pastels, gauche and watercolors apart from my love for acrylics.

This campaign
I am looking for a solo-show in Los Angeles, and I am talking to different galleries and the amount of space they can give me. I need to go with a bear minimum of 10 paintings of size 24"x48". And 10 more smaller ones to come up with different configurations with the layout available in gallery.The entire affair may cost me more than I imagined. I want to mitigate the expenses with the funds I raise here.

Your contributions really help me to work quickly towards my works, finish more in number and submit to a gallery.
 

 
                                                   One of my award winning piece.

How your contributions help meWhat I Need 


Canvas and Paints:$1400
Rental of Space:    Variable cost

Set-up of Space:   $200 
Publicity:              $150 (Brochures and PR)
Transport:            $400 Delivery between studio and gallery
Opening day:        $100

Miscellaneous:      $200TOTAL                 $2450


These are average estimates. So I would like to ask until $1900, and the difference expenses, I would like to take care. If I end up getting more than $1900, it is a good thing.

                                                    I love paining. It costs too.
Let's talk rewards!
This is for a quick look. For each reward, your names also gets listedand remembered for ever.
$5:Limited edition Art-Postcard signed.

 Two different limited edition Art-Postcards. Signed.
 
$25:
 A Limited edition 16 x 30 cm Poster + Postcard. Signed.With different art.
 
$50:
 A Set.
Two different limited edition 16 x 30 Posters. SignedOne Postcard with different art. Signed.Catalog of my works mailed to you
 
$100:
Original piece!
You will get an art sketch on canvas, sized 12 x 22 cmOne limited edition Postcard. Tell others you own such!Your name is embellished
$200:
 Original piece, bigger!
You will get an art sketch on canvas, sized 18 x 30 cmOne limited edition Postcard. Tell others you own such!Your name is embellished

Personal painting! and Original!
