story:
FRIDAY SEPT 26 - LAST DAY OF CAMPAIGN!
I am full-swing into preparing for this weekend's markets!  Will do the best I can with what I have - though things are really really tight so if you're able to contribute that would be a great big help!  I still have staffing, framing, printing and display items to pay for...
Please also check the UPDATES page - for an update with info about Perks as well as some other neat stuff happening.  Thanks to all who have contributed and shared the campaign so far, and those who have really kicked into gear promoting my campaign in its final hours.  Much gratitude and love to you all! 
**********

That's me - Tracy Jager aka livingferal.  I'm an artist in Vancouver, Canada, and I make quirky, poetic and surreal collages.  That's one of them, 'think big,' from my 'aspire' series.  I sell them and other things like printed scarves, pillows and phone cases through my Etsy shop.  I'm currently making the transition to full-time artist.

I've been accepted into two big art markets - The Alumni Art Market @ Emily Carr, and EtsyMade in Canada market - at the end of September.  That's basically three and a half days of markets!  These are going to be high-profile events in locations with lots of traffic, and they're a great opportunity.  I’ve also been contacted by a retail boutique that wants to carry my art – and I have plans to be in touch with others.  The challenge is that I sell my work online and make it on-demand so I don't have a big inventory.  

For several years after graduating from art school I was quite ill, and so was unable to take the usual routes artists might take to establish their careers - I couldn't do large projects or pursue exhibition opportunities.  So I made small pieces like my collages, which I listed on Etsy. I’ve now regained my health, and for the past several months have been working hard to catch up, producing lots of new work and expanding my product range.  However, because I was sick for so long I don't have other forms of credit available to me.  I'm asking for your help so I can produce inventory, and in return I'm offering lots of awesome perks - including prints and other things I'll be creating specifically for this campaign!  

 


'a new perspective (on the world)' - digitally printed silk scarf

The plan (what I need, what you get & the bigger picture)

It's simple, really:  you make a contribution = you get some art!

Now, the details.  My campaign goal is $4500.  The art market organizers expect thousands of people to come to the events, and I want to have lots of items available to wow them with! 

The money raised will be used to:

  • buy fine art papers and archival inks for my giclee prints, and frames for original collages
  • hire a local printer to make copies of my first limited edition artist's book, plus at least one other book I'll make this month - plus notecards, postcards, stickers and business cards.  
  • order digitally-printed silk scarves, velveteen pillow covers and pencil cases, made by a Montreal-based manufacturer I'm working with; they have Canada's only large-scale digital printer of natural fabrics
  • pay two to three people to help me staff my tables, since there is overlap between the market days

As a market vendor, I have to give small items to the first 100 visitors, so I will use some of the things I produce for those.  

I'll also use the pieces to get my work into retail stores. And there's an art book fair this fall I hope to take part in.

This is all part of a larger plan.  Doing these markets, generating further exposure to my art, and getting it into retail shops will help me generate income...these are stepping stones, and will give me room to seek illustration contracts and commissions.  A steadier stream of income will allow me to pursue two very exciting projects that are currently sitting in wait:

  • a collaborative project with the working title ‘the projection room.’ My collaboration partner is a gifted seer and intuitive, and items created will include tools that will allow the user to reflect on their own stories and tap into their subconscious. 
  • a larger project (which I currently envision a book, but could be more) with the working title ‘limbo’; using image and text, it will explore the concept of liminality (the in-between space) and ways to navigate through change and transition.

By supporting me in getting my art to market right now, you’ll be helping to lay the foundation for something bigger and giving me the space needed to do these projects. 

Of course, some of the funding will create the awesome perks I'm offering in exchange for your help! I'll be making a special edition print specifically for the campaign.  Other perks include stickers, cards, pillows, scarves, t-shirts, and books.  There are also options for a custom-made collage.  See the Updates and Gallery section for photos - I'll be posting through the campaign!

 

About me (past, present, future)


''somewhere along the way she found herself' - digitally printed velveteen pillow

I’m a dreamer and storyteller.  It’s important to me that my art have meaning – not always overt or in-your-face, but often multi-layered, sensed as being there under the surface.  

I call my collages 'dreamscapes' because many touch on the idea of dreams - those you might have when sleeping, and those when you're awake.  It is one of my goals to create a sense of wonder and inspire others with the images I create.

I paid my way through art school as a freelance writer and communications consultant, but my dream has long been to become a full-time working artist.  When I received my BFA in Visual Art in 2005 from the Emily Carr University of Art & Design I had big plans.

These were put on hold a few months after I graduated when fire destroyed my home, including my office and studio.  A few months after that I started to become ill, which progressed to the point I was pretty much disabled, unable to do simple tasks like walk my dog, do the dishes, or cook a meal, let alone work or make art.

In 2008 I rallied enough to begin making art again - though because I was still very sick, sometimes down for weeks or months at a time, I was unable to do large projects or pursue exhibition opportunities.  So I made small pieces and put them on Etsy.  I've been blessed to connect and share my art with people around the world, and have received many kind messages from people about how my art has touched them.

In 2012, thanks to the wonders of the internet, I was able to learn more about my health conditions and what I might be able to do, and began the path to healing.  It's been a long journey, but finally, since early 2014, I am well enough that I can be productive every day.  And for the last nine months I've been working hard to create many new collages and expand my products to include pillows, silk scarves, phone cases and more, so people can choose different ways to include my art in their lives.  Because I was ill for such a long time I don't have other types of loans or credit available to me, but I have a plan and I need some help right now to keep things moving.


Make a leap of faith - support the dream!

'yet another leap of faith' - collage from handcut vintage images


As a friend of mine recently said so beautifully, “Art is a treasure and artists are treasure guides.”  I like to believe that my art is both a treasure and a guide, to me and to others...it has certainly helped me navigate through difficult circumstances.  To continue making art even in the face of ongoing adversity requires a special love of creating, and a trust that others will also find the art meaningful. I have held onto the faith about my art and belief that I can see my plan through, and I'm asking for you to take that leap with me.

With the markets and this campaign, I'll be taking every opportunity I can to get word out about my art in the next month and beyond.  I'll be sharing regular updates of newly created pieces and products...I'll be making some new scarf designs, stickers, a little book, and more.  And if you follow my campaign I will also amuse you with occasional pics of me (and maybe even a video!...we'll see).

If my work speaks to you, and you aren't able to contribute financially, you can still help by following what I'm doing, sharing the campaign and getting the word out about my art! 

In addition to my facebook and twitter pages, you can follow me (and my campaign) on:

Pinterest: www.pinterest.com/livingferal/
Tumblr: http://tracyjager-livingferal.tumblr.com/
Flickr: https://www.flickr.com/photos/tjager/

Instagram: http://instagram.com/livingferal

Plus you can see my work on my website, and in my Etsy shop.

And you can sign up for my new monthly newsletter: http://eepurl.com/YQ-wv

If you have any comments or questions about my art or this campaign, I would love to hear from you – just click on my name below under TEAM heading!

A couple of notes

- I've chosen a flexible funding campaign because I have limited time to raise funds, since the markets take place the last weekend of September, and I'm committed to doing them no matter what.

If I pass the target - well that means I've had tons of supporters and I get to create more fabulous things to send out! I'll use any extra money to pursue other opportunities that will help me follow through with the plans I’ve mentioned.

- My campaign is set to receive funds via PayPal.

- In case you're not aware, you can use PayPal to securely use your credit card, even if you don't have a PayPal account.

- If you make a contribution, you'll notice that the email is in my name, but the name on PayPal is someone else - that's Mike, who I live with.  It's the main account I've used for years and it is 'verified,' as it needs to be for an Indiegogo campaign. So no worries, I have access to the account and the funds! I could have another PayPal account verified but that can take a bit of time, so going with this one now...

September, and I'm committed to doing them no matter what.
If I pass the target - well that means I've
had tons of supporters and I get to create more fabulous things to send out! I'll use any extra money to pursue other opportunities
that will help me follow through with the plans I’ve mentioned.
- My campaign is set to receive funds via PayPal.
- In case you're not aware, you can use PayPal to securely use your
credit card, even if you don't have a PayPal account.
- If you make a contribution, you'll notice that the email is in my
name, but the name on PayPal is someone else - that's Mike, who I live with.
 It's the main account I've used for years and it is 'verified,' as it
needs to be for an Indiegogo campaign. So no worries, I have access to the
account and the funds! I could have another PayPal account verified but that
can take a bit of time, so going with this one now...

story:
In 2009 I stumbled upon a craft that has redefined myself as an artist, making large crocheted, wearable masks. Since then I haven't stopped filling people's requests for these wildly expressive masks and it has been the greatest joy watching people come to life with the embodiments of their spirit-freak-animals.


IT'S TIME FOR ME TO BUILD A HOME FOR THE MASK MENAGERIE AND A PLACE TO MAKE THE MAGIC HAPPEN. 

huck and stuff headquarters is ready to come to life in this beautifully refinished 1969 Airstream trailer. Home in the beloved neighborhood of Housatonic, Massachusetts and ready to pop up just about anywhere, this mobile textile workshop will be inviting and inciting a playful and creative riot wherever it may be parked.


To make this dream come true, I'll need to hustle some huck and stuff!
This is a big investment in the work that I have been hyper focused on for the last five years, and it's so worth it. 



THE AIRSTREAM IS AN ICONIC AND INSPIRING PLACE AND I CANNOT WAIT TO EXPLORE ALL THE CREATIVE POSSIBILITIES.... 


AND THE PRICE IS RIGHT! 
For about the same cost of a year and half of rent, I can make a permanent and mobile studio and be able to pop up at art festivals, block parties, work anywhere... and we all know there is nothing I love more than getting all wrapped up in crocheting for hours and hours (anywhere, everywhere) making the spirit-freak-animals for you to get wild with.
I need y'all to get behind some huck and stuff swag so we can make this dream happen.
You can see pics of the perks on the gallery page:
https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/launch-huck-...


You can have your own Unicorn Mask!

story:
Spending all your time finding Bigfoot?

Why not have more fun Painting Bigfoot!

Long time Bigfoot researcher and artist, Michael Esordi, needs your help bringing his famous googly eye creatures to life. Your backing is crucial to the next step of his dream of seeing these characters realized in 3D.

As a partner in this effort you can choose any of a number of great perks. If you like to create, pick one that you can decorate yourself. Don't consider yourself an artist? The team at Googz & Co. will paint one for you!

Taking part in the art and joining list of Bigfooters not enough to convince you to back the project? 

How about one of these great rewards to persuade you?

In addition to receiving your own creature figure, we would like to offer some unique items to increase the value of the perk. Items that anyone interested in the legend of Bigfoot would love to own. From actual plaster casts of Bigfoot and Yeti footprints to a Sasquatch T-shirt, I am sure you will find one or more at the level you prefer. For real fans we even have an autograph cast from Bob Gimlin. While riding with Roger Patterson these men that captured the famous film of a Bigfoot back in 1967.  Bob was there and saw it with his own eyes.

SPECIAL CHROME SQUATCH

You asked for it... You got it! A painted "chrome" Bigfoot hood ornament.                   Now as an available perk. 

PERKS

BIGFOOT HISTORY PACKAGE: There will only be one true Bigfoot enthusiast that will get this amazing package of historical significance. The set includes a one-of-a-kind, autographed, Patterson/Gimlin casts signed by Bob Gimlin. You will even get a photograph of Bob signing your cast.

Then to make it complete you will get a vial of sand from the film location at Bluff Creek, California. The sand was gathered during an expedition Googz & Co. founder, Michael Esordi, organized in 2009. His team: James "Bobo" Fay (Finding Bigfoot), Craig Woolheater (Cryptomundo), Sharon Lee (Bigfoot Field Reporter), Diana Esordi and Brand Pennock (both of Brite Yellow - formerly Believe It Tour).

SASQUATCH & YETI PACKAGE: Can't decide? Get it all! This package includes Both Sasquatch and Yeti plaster casts, one each of the hand painted Sasquatch and Yeti, and both keychains to match.


BEST OF BOTH + T-SHIRT: No need to pick your favorite, you get both! 1 Sasquatch and 1 Yeti creature hand painted by the Googz & Co. artists. Plus you will receive both mini footprint keychains. This perk also comes with a graphic t-shirt in your size from small to x-large.

BELIEVERS: Pick Sasquatch or Yeti and you'll receive a plaster footprint cast of historic importance. The cast will come with the matching creature, hand painted by the team at Googz & Co.

The Sasquatch footprint is the cast from the famous Patterson / Gimlin film site. Bluff Creek, CA, 1967. While the Yeti cast is from the important Eric Shipton photographs of tracks discovered southwest of Mt. Everest, 1951.

PAINTING BIGFOOT PARTY KIT: Our featured perk is perfect if you have  group that wants to get together and create some art. In this kit you will receive 3 blank creatures and craft paint that can be used to paint a Sasquatch, Yeti or both. You even get a paintbrush for details.

HAND PAINTED CREATURES with KEYCHAIN: Select either a Sasquatch or Yeti and the designers at Googz & Co. will hand paint it for you. You will also receive a corresponding keychain of a mini footprint cast.

THE ARTIST: Your own blank creature to paint how you like. Paint and brushes not included.

STICKER SET: Thanks for being a Bigfoot fan, here are 3 stickers for you.


FUNDING

With the help of friend and 3D artist, Matt Paquin, a version of Michael's drawing was converted into a digital sculpture. An important step in allowing us to have a 3D print created and samples made. Personal funds have made it possible to get us through the first phase of the project. 

The next step of the project will require an additional $1,200. Reaching this goal will provide the funds to have a production run from the model. However, we are committed to honor all backing perks even if we are shy of the mark.

BONUS ROUND

Should we reach our goal early, we will begin adding stretch goals. Check the page for updates.


SPECIAL THANKS

It's been an amazing journey and I've met some incredible people along the way. From the early days of exploring the woods of Northern California and starting Bigfoot Surplus to the years of traveling with Believe It Tour, searching for Bigfoot and other mysterious legends around the globe, I have to say THANK YOU! Especially all of  the Bigfooters that have supported my expeditions and art over the years. ~Michael Esordi

perks even if we are shy of the mark.

story:
About Polyflavour

My name is Tracey and I make polymer clay art.  I've been working with polymer clay since a beginning drawing teacher in art school suggested that all the students pick up a mode of creativity apart from drawing, (like knitting or needlepoint) so we didn't get burnt out drawing hundreds of facial features and spheres.  I was a very obedient student so I bought a few packages of polymer clay and I really got into it.  I really love the things I can do with this material.  A big image can be reduced to the size of just a few millimeters without losing any of the details or clarity and I can make a design repeat over and over to make beautiful patterns and I can also sculpt with it so I can make three-dimensional pieces that I cover with slices of polymer clay murrine canes.  Here's a video I made a few years ago of one of my favorite canes. http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ALNRD1eyY8s

I make boxes, bowls, clock faces, refrigerator magnets, key chains, as well as wearable pieces like rings, brooches, earrings, bracelets, pendants, buttons, barrettes, hairpins, chokers, and cufflinks. 
My facebook page is here: https://www.facebook.com/Polyflavour
It's the best place to see most of my work

The purpose of this campaign is to raise money for a stand at the OILL#7 - Marché de créateurs - édition de Noël


This is important to me because it's a great way for me to meet collectors and buyers from all over the world.  Last year I met people from Japan, England, Africa, (of course all over France) and North America. I learn a lot from the comments people make about different pieces and having a fixed date for an event like this gives me more reasons to complete more pieces and push myself to meet new challenges.

I still need frames, risers, a table, printed materials, sandpaper, and MORE CLAY.  If you live in Paris and you have a table, send me a note!

I am listing the prices of my expenses in euros because I live in Paris, but many of my fans are English speakers who live in the USA.  Last year a lot of people told me that the paypal page was in French and it was confusing for them, so I hope I have made it easier by doing it this way. 


For my stand I need:
• picture frames and risers (around 100€)
• printed materials (400€)
• table (100€) last year the owner of the market loaned me a table but this year I need my own table
• assistant to help me, most likely NOT all day each of the four days but I will be compensating him or her 20€ per hour

For the artwork I'll be completing in the next two months I need:
• polymer clay (500€)
• sand paper (100€) I use SO MUCH sand paper!
• dremel bits  (50€)


The Perks

All the perks so far are items that are now available in my etsy store for prices much lower than the retail prices, including shipping outside France, which is a good deal since rates went up 30% in 2014 to about 5USD for small packages.  Here's your chance to have a nice stocking stuffer for a nice price and you're helping make my dreams come true!  I'm busy working on new pieces too so I'll post photos and descriptions of them in the coming days and weeks leading up to the date of the holiday market. 

Sometimes things from Paris reach their destination in less than a week but sometimes they can take longer than four weeks.  I send packages by regular mail.  If you would like me to provide tracking, send me a message and I'll let you know the price, (it's usually three times higher than the cost without tracking).

Faux Suede Tassel Keychains $40
Each tassel is cut from ultrasuede laces that  really look like real suede, (without the fuss and bother of getting the skin off its owner).  The top edge is hand-stitched and securely fastened to the handy swivel lobster claw style keychain and covered in glorious Polyflavour. Choose from nubby haired nancy, sullen sluggo, flip with multi-colored stripes, (not pictured felix with starry background, flip with turquoise and yellow stars on a matching turquoise tassel)


EARRINGS $15
The Bimbo earrings are ball shaped with concentric circles on a black background.  The creep rat earrings are ball shaped with either stars or polka dots.  All the other earrings are flat with stars or concentric circles on the back.  The loops are encased in glass seed beads and the earwires are made from surgical steel. Choose from little felix, creep rat with stars, creep rat with polka dots, bimbo, sluggo with or without a hat.




FRIDGE MAGNETS only $10.  Please specify (left to right, top to bottom) devil guy, fat cannibal, creep rat round, flying ant, baby spider face


Bracelets clockwise from top left, FELIX, FELIX AND HIS HALLUCINATION, CANNIBAL, BABY SPIDERS, BIMBO & SECRET SOCIETY MEMBERS, and PHANTOM GLOVE AND RIBS

Custom Cane (the artwork with the yellow background was provided by Stephanie Wu, based on two of her beloved pets).



Here's the early stages of a box interior that I'm making for Hideaki Otsuka.  It's really fun to work with other artist's whose work I really admire and turn it into something Polyflavourish.




Cufflinks $23!  Choose from Felix, Sluggo, (with or without a hat) Nancy, Satan, Baby Spider, or Creep Rat.  Price includes international shipping.


Flip the Frog Clock!  310mm X 315mm clock with a trippy wavy shape, and an even trippier background in periwinkle blue, orange, glow-in-the-dark with a delicate black outline.  Flip is fetching in wasabi green, ultramarine blue and white.  His middle flipper toes point straight from the center.  If you want, I can use a clock without a second hand.  AA battery not included.


This list of expenses represents my fondest wish.  If I don't reach my goal, I would at the very least like to raise enough to pay for the stand by the deadline. If I don't raise my goal I will do without a paid assistant at the event, and I'll have less materials.  If I don't raise enough to make my stand look awesome, it will just be less than awesome.  I'll do my best with what I have.


I would like to express my deepest gratitude to the people who enthusiastically collect my work and leave such supportive comments on my facebook page.  It truly means the world to me.  Being involved in events like this, and receiving support from people like you really make me grow as an artist and become more and more ambitious about what I can create.



Other Ways You Can Help


Please share this campaign with you friends and fans on facebook, twitter, google plus, etc.  You have no idea how much it helps when a friend shares my campaign and says something nice about me and my work.

Please feel free to email me with any questions or concerns.  I'm on facebook and twitter and you can write to me through indiegogo too.

(Everyone, the poster behind me in the video was created by the inimitable Anne Van Der Linden).

story:
I'm San Francisco artist, Laura Lineback, and I have been given the opportunity to make an iconic piece of San Francisco art - but I need your help in funding it to fruition!

This campaign goes beyond a cool art idea, as it touches me personally. My father, and best friend, passed away, before my very eyes, from a heart attack on December 31st, 2012, at the young age of 60. Losing the most important person in my life has heightened my awareness to preventable heart disease and the wide-reaching demographic that it affects every day. One in three deaths from cardiovascular disease is preventable and more than half of preventable heart disease and stroke deaths happen to people under the age of 65.

I believe this Heart is an opportunity to bring awareness to preventative heart disease, giving both the affected, and their loved ones, an opportunity to overcome the disease and live long, fulfilling lives. Raising the funds to make this happen would mean more than the world to me.


More about #heartsinsf:

Whether a resident of the Bay Area or a tourist fond of the City By The Bay, you've probably heard of or seen the giant heart sculptures located throughout the city. They are literal landmarks that people from all over the world come to visit!

These sculptures are Hearts in San Francisco, an annual public art installation, started in 2004 by the San Francisco General Hospital Foundation for the purpose of fundraising. Every year the hearts are painted by local artists and auctioned off, with the proceeds going to the foundation to provide research, education, patient services, facilities, and equipment purchases.


I am one of NINE (yup, only NINE!!) San Francisco artists awarded the chance to make my design a reality, I just need the funding to continue!


The Idea:

My proposal that was approved is to turn the Heart into a giant, reflective, chrome mirror. The hearts are already popular attractions in SF, with many taking their photos in front of them. Why not take your photo IN one of them? #letmetakeaselfie

Today people are constantly taking pictures on their phones and posting said pics to Instagram and Facebook. I think SFGH's Hearts in San Francisco has a wonderful opportunity to participate in this online discussion. Naming the heart with a hashtag would bring more internet activity surrounding the hearts, which would hopefully raise more money and awareness. The title? "#heartsinsf"


This has never been done before!!

So far, all of the Hearts in San Francisco have been beautifully painted or sculptured by talented artists, but NONE have been so reflective that you could actually take your picture in it.

Once made, this piece will be a way for people to interact with the hearts like never before. This mirrored heart is a reflective microcosm of the individual and the city, the symbiotic relationship between the two; the pain, the growth, the triumphs.  

The Facts:

Turning a 400 lb piece of fiberglass into a slick, chrome, reflective mirror that will stand up to the elements and human interaction is turning out to be a very complicated (and expensive) process!

Originally I anticipated doing a DIY approach, but those materials turned out to be faulty. The reality is to actually accomplish what I proposed to do, I will need aid from trained experts, a much bigger and professional chroming system, and the highest quality of base coat, chrome, and top coat; thus, the campaign!

This sculpture is something that I believe needs to be out in the world; specifically in the HEART of San Francisco! ;) If I do not reach my entire goal, I will fund the remaining balance myself. If I surpass my goal, the extra funds will go to the foundation. Anything that you give helps!


FAQs:

Don't you get funding from the committee?

Yes, $1,000 to be exact! $4,730 is the remaining balance I will need to accomplish this project, which is just the materials! Chrome is fancy stuff ;)

Why can't you just wrap the heart in chrome vinyl?

This was an avenue that I explored thoroughly, but because of the shape and dimensions of the heart, there would be many seams that would be easily picked at by vandals. There would be no way to seal the heart with a clear, anti-graffiti coat, as it will not stick to the vinyl. Also, the highest quality of vinyl still does not have a slick reflection, which would stray from the original design.

How much money will the heart raise?

We'll find out at the annual Hearts in SF luncheon on February 15th, 2015. So far the hearts have raised over $10 million for the foundation. Since my idea is so unique, I anticipate it raising a sizable amount!

Where will this fabulous chrome heart be located?

That will be determined after the Feb 15 luncheon. Currently, the hearts are located all over SF, in Union Square, along the Embarcadero, at AT&T Park, in museums, businesses, parks, and throughout prominent SF neighborhoods.
story_txt:
I'm San Francisco artist, Laura Lineback, and I have been given the opportunity to make an iconic piece of San Francisco art - but I need your help in funding it to fruition!This campaign goes beyond a cool art idea, as it touches me personally. My father, and best friend, passed away, before my very eyes, from a heart attack on December 31st, 2012, at the young age of 60. Losing the most important person in my life has heightened my awareness to preventable heart disease and the wide-reaching demographic that it affects every day. One in three deaths from cardiovascular disease is preventable and more than half of preventable heart disease and stroke deaths happen to people under the age of 65. 
I believe this Heart is an opportunity to bring awareness to preventative heart disease, giving both the affected, and their loved ones, an opportunity to overcome the disease and live long, fulfilling lives. Raising the funds to make this happen would mean more than the world to me.





More about #heartsinsf:Whether a resident of the Bay Area or a tourist fond of the City By The Bay, you've probably heard of or seen the giant heart sculptures located throughout the city. They are literal landmarks that people from all over the world come to visit!


These sculptures are Hearts in San Francisco, an annual public art installation, started in 2004 by the San Francisco General Hospital Foundation for the purpose of fundraising. Every year the hearts are painted by local artists and auctioned off, with the proceeds going to the foundation to provide research, education, patient services, facilities, and equipment purchases.
I am one of NINE (yup, only NINE!!) San Francisco artists awarded the chance to make my design a reality, I just need the funding to continue!





The Idea:
My proposal that was approved is to turn the Heart into a giant, reflective, chrome mirror. The hearts are already popular attractions in SF, with many taking their photos in front of them. Why not take your photo IN one of them? #letmetakeaselfieToday people are constantly taking pictures on their phones and posting said pics to Instagram and Facebook. I think SFGH's Hearts in San Francisco has a wonderful opportunity to participate in this online discussion. Naming the heart with a hashtag would bring more internet activity surrounding the hearts, which would hopefully raise more money and awareness. The title? "#heartsinsf"


This has never been done before!!So far, all of the Hearts in San Francisco have been beautifully painted or sculptured by talented artists, but NONE have been so reflective that you could actually take your picture in it.


Once made, this piece will be a way for people to interact with the hearts like never before. This mirrored heart is a reflective microcosm of the individual and the city, the symbiotic relationship between the two; the pain, the growth, the triumphs.  

   
The Facts:
Turning a 400 lb piece of fiberglass into a slick, chrome, reflective mirror that will stand up to the elements and human interaction is turning out to be a very complicated (and expensive) process! 
Originally I anticipated doing a DIY approach, but those materials turned out to be faulty. The reality is to actually accomplish what I proposed to do, I will need aid from trained experts, a much bigger and professional chroming system, and the highest quality of base coat, chrome, and top coat; thus, the campaign!This sculpture is something that I believe needs to be out in the world; specifically in the HEART of San Francisco! ;) If I do not reach my entire goal, I will fund the remaining balance myself. If I surpass my goal, the extra funds will go to the foundation. Anything that you give helps!
 FAQs:Don't you get funding from the committee? Yes, $1,000 to be exact! $4,730 is the remaining balance I will need to accomplish this project, which is just the materials! Chrome is fancy stuff ;)Why can't you just wrap the heart in chrome vinyl?This was an avenue that I explored thoroughly, but because of the shape and dimensions of the heart, there would be many seams that would be easily picked at by vandals. There would be no way to seal the heart with a clear, anti-graffiti coat, as it will not stick to the vinyl. Also, the highest quality of vinyl still does not have a slick reflection, which would stray from the original design.How much money will the heart raise?We'll find out at the annual Hearts in SF luncheon on February 15th, 2015. So far the hearts have raised over $10 million for the foundation. Since my idea is so unique, I anticipate it raising a sizable amount!Where will this fabulous chrome heart be located?That will be determined after the Feb 15 luncheon. Currently, the hearts are located all over SF, in Union Square, along the Embarcadero, at AT&T Park, in museums, businesses, parks, and throughout prominent SF neighborhoods.

story:
The Editorial is trying to print its 7th issue! This January we are set to launch a 76-page, 8 x 10' perfect-bound book of photography, art, interviews, and artistically-minded fashion spreads. We will be featuring the work of over 20 up-and-coming artists across North America, Japan, and France. 

But we need your help! As we are still just starting up, funding for this project is at zero. We need $2000 to print and distribute our magazine across Canada. 

 

Contributing to this project will not only help us publish our next issue, but it will also help us get out there as an independently run, nation-wide magazine. The Editorial so far has been totally DIY and youth-run, and your help can ensure its success as a long-term establishment! 

 

We appreciate any help you can offer! Even a little goes a long way! 

To see our previous issues and learn more about the magazine, check out our website!

http://www.the-editorialmagazine.com/

story:
Project Introduction

"I just want to go somewhere."
"I want time to recharge myself."
"I need some time alone."

A Road Trip can pertain different meanings.

Whether our life's journey has been flourishing or regretful, one thing remains true: It is within our ability to exercise the power to make all the difference in what we do, how much we do, and how collaboratively we grow with our surroundings and generosity of time. We wish to help understand and create the changes we would like to see in this world by getting out there and doing things that we believe will make a positive difference in this world. That is why we're challenging ourselves to take charge of our time to embark on another journey that will make us scream with joy and sorrow.


Project Summary

Five ambitious and artistic people are going on a journey this summer to experience incredible things in life while producing aritistic forms in each city we stop. Travelling almost 10,000 Km (Seattle-Los Angeles-Las Vegas-Texas-Georgia-New York), we will be on the road for two weeks, collaboratively exchanging creative ideas.

Each members will produce different types of art that they specialize; creating music, videoes, and photos that represent the specific space and atmosphere of the city we're in. 15 days on the road means 15 different places that we'll be visiting! Each video and music will be posted on our website at the end of this year.

 

Project Members

1. Peter Chang ('Fearless' Producer) - Born in Korea, Raised in Toronto, and Working in New York. A Visionary Producer who produces and stage manages various shows across North America and continuously searching for new and fresh talents. Adores all genres of music and DJing occasionally. He has extensive experience in concert touring and show production as well as festivals.

2. Justin Moon ('Ghost' Beatmaker) - Making beats since 1999 as a hobby, now more enriched with his style, he is one of up and coming beatmakers in the Hip-Hop scene. Recently, he debuted as a producer in South Korea and producing for Toronto's only Korean-based Hip-Hop collective, Thoroughbred State. He wants to work on his beats during the trip.

3. Amy Jang ('Naturalistic' Photographer) - Hails from Van City, a girl who is driven by passion and nature. She loves to take photos and would like to capture precious moments and document them daily from this journey. In addition, she is looking forward to visit unknown places and develop her thoughts on life.

4. Jaewook Park (‘Passionate' Videographer) - Born and raised in Seoul, Korea, his deep interest in film grew after he entered OCAD University in Toronto, Canada. Ever since then he started to shoot narrative films. He is an actor and a filmmaker, currently residing in Korea.

5. Sally Jisun Kim ('Practical' Graphic Designer) - A blooming industrial/graphic designer with a heart set on social services, she believes in enriched happiness through good design in our community especially by means of good design.

 

What We Need & What You Get

To have these five travelers safely arrive in the final destination, they need following resources:

1. Accommodation - Camping Sites, Motel, BnB, Airbnb

2. Equipment - Camera Equip, Recording Equip

3. Food - Korean food (Yay!) all the way

4. Gas - Car needs to eat too!

5. Other - Toll Fees, Admission Fees, Extra Costs

 

By supporting us, we would like to share our experience with you:

$10 - A Huge THANK YOU and we will update you with our projects

$25 - Our Lovely Handmade Postcard specially made for you + All Previous Perks 

$50 - Group Video Message specially made for you + All Previous Perks

$100 - Your name mentioned in our 'The Grand Journey' documentary + All Previous Perks

$250 - Specially packaged gift box which includes a Documentary DVD, Exclusive Traveling Photos + All Previous Perks

 

The Impact

We believe that from this journey, we can learn multiple things:

- To promote true art movement that comes from dedication and inspiration

- To encourage others to start their own journey with a goal and find their own way while sharing their experiece with others

- To explore and share experience from each city and enrich other with insights and stories

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

You can support us in other various ways:

1. Post our video on your Social Networking Websites: igg.me/at/thegrandjourney

2. Like our Facebook Page: www.facebook.com/thegrandjourney

3. Follow us: #t_grandjourney

4. Like our Youtube Video: 

 

Now let's start THE GRAND JOURNEY!

Other Ways You Can Help
You can support us in other various ways:
1. Post our video on your Social Networking Websites: igg.me/at/thegrandjourney
2. Like our Facebook Page: www.facebook.com/thegrandjourney
3. Follow us: #t_grandjourney

story:
Salamet siang, Friends! 

     This Summer I've been given an immense opportunity: To live and teach in Bali-- A destination known for its' well preserved cultural richness and tropical locale. Widely adored by the western world, Bali has recently found a "boom" in its economy through the tourism industry. However, I travel to Bali as an Artist and Educator whose intentions are to live, work, and play in a new and inspirational environment. With priority to teaching english to Village Children near Ubud--The arts center of Bali, I am working on the creation of an Experimental Film and accompanying book of poetry and drawings. 

My experience will create raw-materials for a generative conversation between Nature and Structure, with special attention to the Island's relationship to the Ocean and its Flora and Fauna. The accompanying book is an extension of this material--a series of poetic gestures and collages of text and image. 

 The island is my studio and playground. I've found a time and place to make Art--now I need your help to realize this goal!

 

 

About The Artist

 

     Meghan received her Bachelors' of Fine Arts in Experimental Animation from CalArts in 2013.

She is a recepient of the esteemed Jules Engel Scholarship, the Dean's Travel Abroad Grant and in 2012 was the Dean's Candidate for the internationally recognized Princess Grace Award.

She has studied Film at École Nationale Supérieure des Arts Décoratifs in Paris, France, and has shown work in Paris and Los Angeles.

Meghan currently teaches Animation at the Watts Towers Arts Center. 

 

SUPPORT

Funds will go towards:

  • HD Camera / Zoom + 50mm Lens / Filters / Sound Equipment
  • Travel Expenses
  • Printing Materials

All perks are made with love! From Limited Edition Prints to Hand-picked souvenirs from  Bali. I am deeply thankful for all contributions!

 

THANK YOU!!!!

 

Photos provided by Chelsea Thompson

story:
Our Goal

Jack Farley's Art Supplies has grown but our ecommerce site has not been able to keep up with what our devoted shoppers need!  We are on a mission to make their searching and shopping experience more superb moving forward! What's missing? The resources to grow our ecommerce site. The funding that you will help provide will enable us to hire a part-time person to build the new site, a person devoted to meeting the growing needs of our online shoppers!

What is wrong with our current site http://www.ShopJackFarleys.com you may ask?

  • Search Engine is too slow, loads more search results than requested.
  • Pages load too slow for some shoppers.
  • No guest check-in. Sometimes people do not want to register and want a quick checkout.
  • Current site does not provide multiple images of the products available.
  • Some search results bring multiple results with duplicate image, even though for example, the tubes of paint should be showing different colors.

The GREAT NEWS is that our new site will resolve the issues listed above! So come join the fun, support our growth and take part in our success! You'll help make us better! 

Ready to Help?

Here are the levels of assistance that you can provide to help make this project a reality!

Give $25 and Get 10% Off all your purchases thru 2013!

Give $25 or more and we'll give you a special Jack Farley's Art Supplies Membership that gives you 10% Off all of your in-store or online purchases thru 2013!

Give $80 and Get 25% Off all your purchases thru 2013!

Give $80 or more and we'll give you a special Jack Farley's Art Supplies Membership that gives you 25% Off all of your in-store or online purchases thru 2013!

Give $800 and get a $300 Gift Card Plus 25% Off thru 2013!

Give $800 or more and we'll give you a special Jack Farley's Art Supplies Membership that gives you 25% Off all of your in-store or online purchases thru 2013 PLUS a $300 Gift Card to be used in-store or online!

Unable to contribute financially at this time?

That's okay! We do understand! You can help spread the word by sharing our link with others! If you register here with us, and when we meet our goal, we'll have a special gift to send you as a big thanks for your support!

story:
Welcome to KÚBOS - The ultra dense cube everyone has been waiting for.

With ultimate density, the cubes are forged from 99.9% pure aerospace grade tungsten. We at KÚBOS have made it a point to produce the perfect cube made from one of the densest materials known to man.  

A single 1" cube has an astonishing weight of 0.3 kilograms! That is equivalent to holding 2x iPhone 6 in your hand!


We are excited to be featured on BackerClub.co this week! They are the top community for people who are very serious about Kickstarter and we are really looking forward to the feedback and support from their community of super-backers!





What is it like to hold one of the most purest and densest element in the palm of your hands? 

"Feels powerful!" - Damien P.



"I cannot believe the weight on this cube!" - John H.
"Strongest cube you could ever own!" - Ryan P.
"This will look great on my desk! Thank you KÚBOS!" - Noreen W.
"Super cool, what an awesome piece if art." - Christoph O.
"This is what it feels like to hold 99.9% of pure tungsten!" - Abigail L.
"Great project, simple and beautiful :)" - George W.
"The ultimate conversation starter forged from pure tungsten!" - Nathan L.
"Adding this to my collection of minimalistic treasures!" - Braden O.
"The perfect thing for any office or home." - Jesse L.
"You will be shocked by the weight once you've picked up the cube!" - Erik J. 
"I cannot wait for this project to be live! Rest assured, all my friends will know about this too." - Sam D.

Why do i need this cube? 

  • You are a collector of all things quirky and unique
  • You want the ultimate desk candy
  • You want to possess the mother of all conversation starters
  • You want to have the coolest totem to unleash your inner creativity 
  • You are an educator who loves to bring excitement to your class, shocking them with the density of the cube.
  • You want to be an owner of the densest thing you could ever own in that size.

Why Tungsten?

  • One of the hardest metal on earth
  • Denser than Uranium
  • Most scratch resistant metal
  • 4 times harder than Titanium 
  • Highest melting point of all metals at 3422 degree celsius 
  • The heaviest of all elements known to play a biological role
  • 1800% denser than water





If you want to be amazed by the pure density of the cube, please support our campaign and make our dream a reality!


To share, please use the links in our campaign page so that our team can record your entry!



Thank you for checking out our project. We plan to deliver all geometrically perfect cubes by Apr 2016!


Risks & Challenges

We have tested our prototypes and we are all geared up and ready to go into full production and make this dream a reality. Delivering a product that is of utmost quality is our highest goal.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you like our campaign, share it with your friends and family. Be it through other social media platforms or word of mouth, we appreciate your support!

KÚBOS thanks you for being apart of this community!

story:
Our Story

We are Amanda Thomas, Jordy Pastor, and Ari Rose: three hardworking young people on different paths in life, united on this project by our love of creation, interactivity, and the culture of Burning Man.  We are dedicated to using repurposed materials in the construction of this piece whenever possible.   In this age of commodification, consumption and disposability, turning discarded materials into art is a constructive rebellion against consumerism and its wastefulness.


Amanda is a young mother of one, and primarily a visual artist whose work has recently begun expanding to include larger scale sculptures and installations.  Her work is usually very intimate, and she believes the best way to express the universal is through the personal.  AudioOracle is her latest brainchild.

Jordy fell in love with art at an early age when he began experimenting in three-dimensional forms. After working with several different mediums, the attraction to clean lines lead him to pursue carpentry and welding where his attention to detail and constructive knowledge has greatly expanded.  He hopes his work will continue to evolve as he works with new mediums and new people.

Ari has a history of doing way too many things at once, such as visual 2D/3D art, music of various styles and instruments and philosophical and scientific pursuits in the hopes that she can somehow advance the human species and its understanding of the Universe. Controversially, she is an artist/scientist of few words, yet still a master of the run-on sentence.


We want to bring our wonderful piece to Burning Man (and many other places) so everyone can interact with it!


The Project

AudioOracle is a pyramid-shaped structure with two levels.  It is solar powered and constructed from mostly repurposed, salvaged, and recycled materials. 

When participants enter the first level, they will see a post with a microphone, a button, and directions.  At the press of the button, anything the participant wishes to say will be recorded.  After they go up the ladder to the second level, they will see a seated, shrouded figure.  This is the Oracle.  There is another button in front of the Oracle (and some very simple directions).  When the participant presses the button, a recording is randomly selected from all of the recordings other participants have made, and played for the current participant.  This means that voice matters in the world, and that every participant's voice matters, regardless of age, gender, race, class, or any other of those irrelevancies that divide us in our day to day lives.  The element of randomness should provide for much synchronicity and delight, as well as many surprises!


If we cannot get funding for this campaign, we most likely will not be able to complete construction, and we will not be able to bring our piece to Burning Man.  $1000 will cover all of our costs, down to transport to and from the event (though not transport to other places we are hoping to set it up).


What We Need

Materials list and estimated cost (where applicable):

Used laptop: gifted!

Plexiglass/plastic sheets: salvaged

Screws: $5

Wiring caps: $8

Staples: $10

Microphone: $5

Speaker: $20

Cords for electronics: gifted!

LEDs: salvaged

Wood: salvaged, possible purchase of 2x4s

Flour: $15

Newspaper: salvaged

Waterproofing liquid: $30

Extension cords (used): gifted!

Solar setup (including panels, inverter, battery bank): $600

USB buttons: $20

Solar lights: $30

Gas (to Burning Man, estimated): $125

Trailer rental: $30

Possible extra speaker, and possibly 2 extra USB buttons


With projects like this, I have found there are always unforeseen costs.


Other Ways You Can Help

Promote us!  We need the word out about our project.  Use the link above to "like" us on Facebook, and share this page.

Also, if you live in the Santa Cruz or Mt. Shasta area and have materials to donate, we are looking for 2x4's, plexiglass and/or plastic sheeting, screws, and old extension cords.

Cheap deep cycle batteries and broken solar panels/solar cells.

Also, since we are planning on bringing AudioOracle to Burning Man, we are always looking for lovely participants to help us set up and tear down at the event!  We appreciate any leads on tickets to the event; so far, only one team member has obtained one.
